intro: Voacanga obtusa, commonly known as the African blackwood tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, heavy wood and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has elliptic to ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hard seeds. Voacanga obtusa is also valued for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional remedies.
